reviewText: The DVD came clearly used and did not include the trains.  Very disappointing... not at all as advertised.
This is a good Thomas video. I bought if for my nephew and he watches it all the time.
Like all the Thomas programs, this one delights the grandchildren endlessly! Interesting stories, characters, music and songs.

I bought this on Amazon on sale for $8.49.  Definately worth it.  Just a wooden Thomas costs more than that at the store!  This came with a standard blue wooden Thomas the Tank Engine and a silver "60th anniversary edition" Percy.  Both are the same exact models as you'd purchase for the wooden track system at the store.  Cool!  The video is your usual Thomas video, our son seems to like it.  We only let him watch videos on long car trips so I confess I haven't seen the video myself, only heard it from the front seat.  He is only 24 months old and gets scared at some parts (such as a dam collapsing) so we have to skip over a lot of the video for now.  Overall pleased with the deal.
I ordered this because it shows Thomas as the train that comes with the video but I got a different train.  It's the right video and my son likes it - but not Thomas the Train
The program is very silly for Adults, but Kids stay glued to the TV watching the narration of wooden trains!  It is very annoying for Adults!
Haven't watched the DVD yet, Christmas present, but it DOES NOT have a double train as it says in the description.  It is as pictured.  Amazon needs to correct this.
My Grandson loves it and so did I.

We love Thomas.  We watch him regularly with out grandkids.  We like that the stories are short and you can use them as a bribe to "eat your lunch"!  We love the fact that we get them free with Amazon Prime and it is very convenient to access on my Fire stick.

The Thomas series of books available for the kindle are great for 1-3 year olds. I have Amazon Prime so I just use different ones whenever my grandson comes out. If you have children  or grandchildren these books have good story lines and great narration.

Keeps my grandson entertained. Very educational also.
Thomas is always a hit with my toddler son. The simplicity and message of Thomas is a nice refreshing moment in today's society.

I can only watch Thomas the train so many times, but my son LOVES Thomas & Percy. I love that trains are given personalities, it's a cute idea. I just can't watch them for long, but I get it, they're not for me! I like all the unique names of the trains & the different personalities & moods that they illustrate. I think it's important for little ones to learn what their feelings mean. He knows a lot of their names, but Thomas & Percy are his favorites.
A childhood favorite in my house - finally got the dvd
Happy to have this to replace a VHS tape.

my 2 yr old is a huge Thomas fan.  this is probably the 10th DVD i've picked up.  picture quality is good, and at 5$ i don't mind if it gets scratched up.
My son collects Thomas DVDs and he wanted this one. It is an older one and I am glad we found it on here!

The DVD came in fairly good condition and my son likes it. Sometimes it skips in a few spots but I just breathe on it and wipe it with a cloth and it's good as new again. Not bad for just a few bucks. It made my son happy so that's priceless. :)

My son loves Thomas the train, so I came on here to see if I could find any new movies and I did, after I thought I had found them all. He loves these movies and watches them over and over again. I do not mind because I have a hard time monitoring what he can watch on cable.

Thomas and Friends are back again. Older stories are funny (or corny) in these episodes. He seems to enjoy this collection due to the action and less talk as seen in other Thomas series. My son is almost three and has his certain picks. He always goes back to Thomas for his relaxation time.

My young son was/is a HUGE Thomas the Tank Engine fan. As he was growing up I purchased many of these VHS Tapes and later DVDs for him to watch. It was my observation that he enjoyed hearing Ringo Star's voice as the narrator above all the others, and so, many videos were watched more repeatedly than others.

They are all fun to watch, with beautiful scenic backgrounds, and beautiful model trains. The voices and scenarios are both fun and educational, and every episode comes with a lesson to be learned in it. This particular video also came with a toy train that fit his collection, and could be used on the same wooden tracks.

While my son is older now - seven and no longer two or three (the pinnacle of his Thomas days), I still get nostalgic seeing these, and will occasionally put one into the DVD player when no one else is around. Great fun for kids and parents alike.
My son loves this DVD. He could watch it over and over  if you let him. This DVD has the more exciting stories.
